intro: Allantodia australis, commonly known as the Australian flax or broad-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It is often found in open habitats such as dunes and coastal heaths. Allantodia australis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally by Indigenous Australians for various purposes.
